pullrequest.title: Add filter by IP option to traffic shaper

content.raw:
OK, these are the same numbers but read from the iperf server (the FC ): 
```
$ iperf -s
------------------------------------------------------------
Server listening on TCP port 5001
TCP window size: 85.3 KByte (default)
------------------------------------------------------------
[  4] local 192.168.2.10 port 5001 connected with 192.168.2.150 port 58390
[ ID] Interval       Transfer     Bandwidth
[  4]  0.0-677.2 sec   256 KBytes  3.10 Kbits/sec
```
Interestingly , from the server point of view, the bandwith was lower than 4Kbit/sec . So I think we are OK here.
content.html:
OK, these are the same numbers but read from the iperf server (the FC ): 

$ iperf -s
------------------------------------------------------------
Server listening on TCP port 5001
TCP window size: 85.3 KByte (default)
------------------------------------------------------------
[  4] local 192.168.2.10 port 5001 connected with 192.168.2.150 port 58390
[ ID] Interval       Transfer     Bandwidth
[  4]  0.0-677.2 sec   256 KBytes  3.10 Kbits/sec

Interestingly , from the server point of view, the bandwith was lower than 4Kbit/sec . So I think we are OK here.
